CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 21, 1966, page 1A reads: "Bombard A Negro Church With Rocks - Vandalized Church - The Rev. Samuel Trotter (left) pastor of the Church of Christ, an all-Negro congregation in predominantly white Knoxville, examines a few of the rocks which were thrown through windows of his church last Sunday. The photo at right, shows the Climax St. side of the Church of Christ in Millbridge St. in Knoxville, a predominantly white community.  Church has been vandalized many times since all-Negro congregation took it over four years ago.  Last Sunday it was the victim of severe rock-throwing which broke many windows as shown above.  Harris photo"
TitMainTitle: Church of Christ with broken stained glass windows, corner of Millbridge and Climax Streets, Beltzhoover
